name: The myterious fortune teller
mes: Gira is a wandering hero in a new town who has just taken out a group of bandits. He goes around the city, looking for the guild. He had heard rumors about bad things happening in the town and didn't wish to stay around, unless there was an opportunity to make money that is. It had been a time for Gira and many things were on his mind. Saving princesses, defeating the demon queen, getting enough money... at least he could work things out one step at a time.

name: The myterious fortune teller
mes:
Gira wandered through the bustling market square, something catching his eye amidst the numerous stalls. Tucked between a vendor selling fruits and a blacksmith was a mysterious stall, almost hidden in plain sight. The stall was adorned with thick, tattered blue cloth, old tokens, and candles flickering with strange light. Behind the table stood a figure in a black shaman-like outfit, her face obscured by a dirty gray-white mask with a purple spiral.

The masked figure gestured towards a mesmerizing purple crystal ball emitting a soft, alluring spiral glow. Her hands moved with hypnotic grace around the orb, her fingers caressing it suggestively in rhythmic motions that seemed almost sensual.

"Come closer, my dear wanderer," the fortune teller spoke with a deep, inviting Slavic accent. "I sense a troubled heart within you. Allow me to read your fortune and help you find your path."

The faint light from the candles danced upon the table covered by the worn, blue fabric. Amulets, wooden signs with unreadable language, and other mystical items surrounded the crystal ball. Gira felt an inexplicable pull towards this enigmatic woman.

"Step forward," she beckoned with a subtle, almost magnetic authority.

mes:

mes: Tell me how my next quest will go
